frame.name: Planned_trajectory
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen> traverses a trajectory. This trajectory consists of a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, and <fen>Goal</fen>. If the <fen>Theme</fen> is sentient, the anticipated trajectory will usually be equivalent to the planned trajectory. If the the <fen>Theme</fen> is non-sentient the anticipated trajectory will usually be the result of various forces acting upon the <fen>Theme</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Theme">The dog</fex> <m>went</m> that <t>way</t><fex name="Goal">towards the ice cream factory</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that traverses the trajectory. </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> profiles the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> has travelled from (i.e. the region where the <fen>Theme</fen>'s movement began). </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> is the region upon which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels. It is any region in between the <fen>Source</fen> (where the <fen>Theme</fen> departed from) and the <fen>Goal</fen> (where the theme will eventually arrive). </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> profiles the region at the end of the <fen>Theme</fen>'s <fen>Path</fen>. This is the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> movement stops. </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> provides additional information that characterizes one or more of the aspects of the trajectory: the <fen>Source</fen>, the <fen>Path</fen>, or the <fen>Goal</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: way.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the trajectory that will lead a theme from some prior location to a desire or intended goal.
